title: US Open: Carlos Alcaraz meets Casper Ruud in final as world number one spot to be decided
description: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz and Norway's Casper Ruud meet for the US Open title and the men's world number one ranking in Sunday's final.

title: 'I want to see the rainbow flag raised in Iran'
description: One of two lesbians sentenced to death in Iran had spoken to the BBC about her hopes for the future.

title: Liz Truss and Joe Biden: The big issue that could derail UK/US relations
description: Expect unity on Ukraine and China but there's one worrying point of tension between the UK and US.

title: Vivid interactions between Crown and parliament
description: In the coming days, the new head of state, the King, and the PM will visit Edinburgh, Belfast and Cardiff.

title: England v India: Glenn, Dunkley & Capsey star as hosts cruise to victory
description: England race to an emphatic nine-wicket victory with 42 balls to spare in the first T20 international against India.

title: William and Harry united in grief
description: What messages were sent by Prince William and Catherine, Prince Harry and Meghan, appearing together?

title: Memories of Queen on coffin's route to Edinburgh
description: Her cortege from Balmoral to Edinburgh will wend its way past the villages, towns and cities she knew so well.

title: William, Harry, Meghan and Kate on walkabout outside Windsor
description: Thousands of people had gathered throughout the day outside the castle before the four arrived.

title: Charles III greets crowds after proclamation ceremony
description: The new monarch speaks to well-wishers after leaving Buckingham Palace.

title: England v South Africa: Hosts hold slim advantage at The Oval in decider
description: England hold the advantage over South Africa in the third and final Test after 17 wickets fell on a day that began with cricket paying tribute to Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II.

title: British horse racing cancelled on day of Queen's funeral on 19 September
description: British horse racing is cancelled on the day of Queen Elizabeth II's funeral, which will take place on Monday 19 September.

title: In pictures: Pomp and ceremony as Charles becomes King
description: Images from the day as Charles III officially becomes monarch.

title: Ex-PMs on taking Queen's advice and King's 'long apprenticeship'
description: Gordon Brown, David Cameron and Theresa May share memories of the Queen with Laura Kuenssberg.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: A day-by-day guide from now to the funeral
description: The Queen's coffin will lie in state in Westminster Hall as King Charles III embarks on a trip around the UK.

title: Late try seals Exeter win over champions Leicester
description: Patrick Schickerling's last-second try helps Exeter come back to beat champions Leicester 24-20 at Sandy Park.

title: Chris Kaba: Stormzy speaks at fatal police shooting protest
description: The rapper joined hundreds outside the Metropolitan Police's headquarters - New Scotland Yard.

title: William, Kate, Harry and Meghan view tributes
description: All four of the royals are seen together to view tributes to the Queen.

title: Queen to lie in state for four full days before state funeral
description: People will be able to view the Queen's coffin at Westminster Hall and pay respects in Edinburgh.

title: Queen was with me at happiest and saddest times - William
description: The Prince of Wales says the world "lost an extraordinary leader" while he lost his "Grannie".

title: Saturday's sport pays tribute to Queen Elizabeth II
description: Tributes are paid as sport resumes on Saturday following the death of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Italian Grand Prix: Charles Leclerc takes pole position for Ferrari
description: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc takes pole position at the Italian Grand Prix ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen.

title: Queen's youngest children greet crowds
description: The Queen's three younger children, Princess Anne, Prince Andrew and Prince Edward were among those viewing floral tributes.

title: Super League play-offs: Huddersfield Giants 0-28 Salford Red Devils - Visitors to face St Helens in semi-final
description: Salford beat Huddersfield Giants in the Super League play-off eliminator to set up a semi-final at St Helens.

title: Hong Kong: Five jailed in for 'seditious' children's books
description: Authorities said the books, about sheep trying to hold back wolves, referred to the Beijing government.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Royal Family meet well-wishers at Balmoral
description: Princess Anne and Princes Andrew and Edward were alongside their children to read tributes left by the public.

title: Senior MPs take oath of allegiance to King Charles
description: In a rare Saturday sitting, a group of senior MPs were given the chance to formally pledge their loyalty to the king.

title: King Charles's address in full at proclamation ceremony
description: The King says he is "deeply aware" of the duties and responsibilities he has inherited as sovereign.

title: 'After a week of profound change, our unsettled kingdom seeks a steady hand'
description: The immediate challenge for King Charles is to do what his mother was so good at - reassuring an anxious nation.

title: Manchester IRA 1996 bomb: Man released after arrest
description: He was initially detained on suspicion of terrorism by officers at Birmingham Airport on Thursday.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Ninth arrest in murder inquiry
description: A 37-year-old man is being held on suspicion of assisting an offender after the girl was killed.

title: Bank holiday approved for day of Queen's funeral
description: Charles III approves an order for the bank holiday - although the funeral date itself has not yet been confirmed.

title: England v South Africa: Tributes paid to Queen before Test begins
description: Tributes are paid to Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II on day three of the third Test between England and South Africa at The Oval.

title: New Zealand: Whale may have caused boat flip that killed five
description: Mayor Craig Mackle says the whale may have surfaced beneath the boat causing it to capsize.

title: Charles formally confirmed as king in ceremony televised for first time
description: Charles III is proclaimed as monarch in the first televised Accession Council.

title: Wendy Buckney: Clydach man, 55, charged with murder
description: Retired horsewoman Wendy Buckney, who founded a riding centre and livery yard, died last month.

title: Kharkiv offensive: Russia surprised as Ukraine takes several towns - UK
description: President Zelensky says Ukraine has retaken 30 settlements in its eastern offensive this week.

title: Edinburgh roads close as city prepares for Queen mourners
description: Major routes are closed as the city prepares to become a focal point for people mourning the Queen.

title: The Queen at Windsor: A place of work and rest
description: Windsor held a special place in the monarch's heart, it was also a place of work right to the end.

title: Air pollution cancer breakthrough will rewrite the rules
description: Research shows that cancers might not always be caused by DNA mutations, as previously thought.

title: The Queen and Martin McGuinness' four-second handshake
description: How the eyes of the world watched the Queen and former IRA leader Martin McGuinness shake hands.

description: Discover more about Elizabeth II through films and programmes that offer insights into her life.
